param.name: input_mtdDST_table
param.displayname: Input Metadata Daylight Saving Time (MtdDST) Table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the metadata for daylight saving time. This table is typically named "MtdDST".

param.name: input_mtdCntryRef_table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the metadata for country references. This table is typically named "MtdCntryRef".

param.name: input_mtdArea_table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the metadata for administrative areas. This table is typically named "MtdArea".

param.name: input_adminBndy_feature_classes
param.displayname: Input Administrative Area Boundaries (AdminBndy) Feature Classes
param.dialogReference:
The polygon feature classes of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represent the administrative area boundaries. These feature classes are typically named "AdminBndy1", "AdminBndy2", "AdminBndy3", "AdminBndy4", and "AdminBndy5".

You only need to specify those feature classes that contain data for your area of interest. For example, in the United States, only the AdminBndy1 (country), AdminBndy2 (state), AdminBndy3 (county), and AdminBndy4 (city) feature classes contain data.

param.name: output_file_geodatabase
param.dialogReference: The full path including the name of the file geodatabase to be created containing the resulting time zone feature classes and tables.

param.name: input_streets_feature_class
param.dialogReference: The line feature class of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the streets. This feature class is typically named "Streets".This parameter must be specified together with the Time Zone ID Base Field Name parameter.

param.name: time_zone_id_base_field_name
param.displayname: Time Zone ID Base Field Name
param.dialogReference: Determines the name of the fields to be created in the output Streets feature class. The fields created in the Streets feature class will be named with "FT_" and "TF_" prefixed on the provided base field name.

parameters.summary: This tool reads in NAVTEQ™ NAVSTREETS™ data and creates a file geodatabase with a polygon feature class of the time zones. If the Streets feature class is provided, then the output file geodatabase will also contain a Streets feature class and a TimeZones table for use in creating a network dataset with time zone information by using the ProcessNavStreetsData tool.
parameters.usage: • Multiple regions of NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data can be processed together to create larger output feature classes. First use the Merge tool to combine the similar layers of the NAVSTREETS data into common feature classes and tables, then pass these combined feature classes and tables as inputs to this tool.

scriptExample.title: ProcessNavStreetsTimeZoneData Python Example
scriptExample.para: Create time zone data from NAVSTREETS data
scriptExample.code:
# Name: ProcessNavStreetsTimeZoneData_nasample.py # Description: Create time zone data from NAVSTREETS data. # Author: ESRI
#Import system modules import arcpy from arcpy import env
#Import the toolbox containing the tool arcpy.ImportToolbox("C:/MyTools/Vendor Data Processing Tools.tbx")
#Set environment settings env.workspace = "C:/data/NAVSTREETS"
#Set local variables inMtdDST = "MtdDST.dbf" inMtdCntryRef = "MtdCntryRef.dbf" inMtdArea = "MtdArea.dbf" inAdminBndy1 = "AdminBndy1.shp" inAdminBndy2 = "AdminBndy2.shp" inAdminBndy3 = "AdminBndy3.shp" inAdminBndy4 = "AdminBndy4.shp" outFileGDB = "Hawaii.gdb" inStreets = "Streets.shp" baseFieldName = "TimeZoneID"
#Create the time zone data arcpy.ProcessNavStreetsTimeZoneData_nasample(in MtdDST, inMtdCntryRef, inMtdArea, [inAdminBndy1, inAdminBndy2, inAdminBndy3, inAdminBndy4], outFileGDB, inStreets, baseFieldName)
print "Script completed successfully."

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool reads in NAVTEQ™ NAVSTREETS™ data and creates a file geodatabase with a polygon feature class of the time zones. If the Streets feature class is provided, then the output file geodatabase will also contain a Streets feature class and a TimeZones table for use in creating a network dataset with time zone information by using the ProcessNavStreetsData tool.
